pageContext.claim: “You know, many presidents don't get a chance to put a Supreme Court justice on.”
pageContext.analysis: Only four out of 44 presidents failed to get a chance to make a Supreme Court appointment, most recently Jimmy Carter. William Henry Harrison, who was president just a month, and Zachary Taylor, who was president for 16 months, also failed to have a vacancy occur on their watch. Andrew Johnson made a nomination but Congress lowered the number of jurists on the court and so the nomination did not go through.
